feed.title: Track Github Cheat Sheet Updates Weekly
feed.subtitle: A list of cool features of Git and GitHub.

entry.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Feb 03 - Feb 09, 2020
entry.content:
Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

  • Pressing s will focus the search field for the current repository. Pressing ‚Üì to select the ‚ÄúAll GitHub‚Äù option changes the field to search all of GitHub.
entry.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Feb 03 - Feb 09, 2020

entry.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Sep 05 - Sep 11, 2016
entry.content:
Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

  • Pressing y when looking at a file (e.g., https://github.com/tiimgreen/github-cheat-sheet/blob/master/README.md) will change your URL to one which, in effect, freezes the page you are looking at. If this code changes, you will still be able to see what you saw at that current time.

Git Grep / GitHub Talks

  • -e The next parameter is the pattern (e.g., regex)
entry.summary: 2 awesome projects updated on Sep 05 - Sep 11, 2016

entry.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Feb 01 - Feb 07, 2016
entry.content:
Empty Commits / GitHub Talks

  • The first commit of a repository: git commit -m "Initial commit" --allow-empty.
entry.summary: 1 awesome projects updated on Feb 01 - Feb 07, 2016

entry.title: Github Cheat Sheet Updates on Apr 21 - Apr 27, 2014
entry.content:
Keyboard Shortcuts / Compare Branches across Forked Repositories

  • Pressing t will bring up a file explorer.
  • Pressing w will bring up the branch selector.
  • Pressing l will edit labels on existing Issues.

Stripspace / GitHub Talks

  • Strips trailing whitespace
  • Collapses newlines
  • Adds newline to end of file

Empty Commits / GitHub Talks

  • Annotating the start of a new bulk of work or a new feature.
  • Documenting when you make changes to the project that aren't code related.
  • Communicating with people using your repository.
entry.summary: 9 awesome projects updated on Apr 21 - Apr 27, 2014
